u.a: picks up the small green plastic turtle

CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi seem to get along , but they do not play together at all. Chi asks about three times during the activity if they are done yet. EXP stays in the background. Mot and Chi work independently for the most part throughout the activity. Mot tries to introduce the qualities of magnets to Chi a few times , for example by showing Chi how the balls repel each other , but Chi is not interested. There is some brief talk about how the thin refrigerator-type magnets aren't strong , that they <don't have enough magnet in them>. Chi does ask if everything is a magnet , but there isn't much discussion around this. MOT and Chi sit on a couch; the magnets and other toys (turtle , lego pieces , etc.) are on a coffee table in front of them; Chi is removing objects from the black base

u.a: MOT is reaching over to help Chi remove objects from the base
holds the base magnet in one hand; on top of it rests a white ball; Chi moves the base in a circular motion , watching the white ball move around on the base
picks up a paper clip with the yellow wand , and then removes the paper clip and places it back on the coffee table
picks the paper clip back up with the wand , removes it , and places it back on the coffee table
attempts to pick up the orange and white ball with the red ball; neither the orange or the white ball will attach to the red ball
picks up a washer with the yellow wand
the wand already has four washers on it and no other objects
picks up a nut and a silver stick with they yellow wand; removes these from the wand
picks up a washer and a silver man with the wand; removes the silver man
rearranges a washer on the yellow wand
places the silver stick on the yellow wand
whispered
EXP
sits back onto the couch; then moves to the table again and moves some of the objects around and touches them together
holds up the yellow wand with two washers and a silver stick placed diagonally between them on two opposite sides of the wand; the washer and stick arrangement looks like a percent sign
hits his forehead with the yellow wand , crosses his eyes; the duh gesture
picks up a nut with the yellow wand
picks up an object which isn't a nut; removes it from the wand
Chi has picked up all the large nuts with the yellow wand
reaches across Chi to get the base magnet
mumbled
pushes a ball so that it hits into the other balls; the balls move around on the black base
moves the black base closer to Chi in order to better show him how the balls move on the base

holds the yellow wand in one hand; on top of the wand was a pyramid of nuts and washers; with the other hand , Chi picks up the flat silver circle and moves it toward the bottom of the yellow wand; the silver circle sticks to the wand and part of the pyramid falls
removes the silver circle from the wand , and works on setting the pyramid back up
the fallen pyramid
removes all the pieces from the wand and begins making a new structure
closes hand around the balls on the magnetic base , and then releases them; magnetic repulsion keeps the balls from staying together when Mot releases them; they quickly spread out on the base
picks up two washers and rubs them together to demonstrate
removes pieces from the yellow wand
stacks nuts on top of each other on the wand; then moves to put a silver stick into the middle of the nuts; the tower falls
the fallen tower
MOT can't get a silver man to stand up on the black base; the flat silver circle which allows the men to stand easily isn't on the base
EXP
places a silver ball on top of the tower of nuts and then removes the ball
puts a silver stick into the middle of the tower of nuts; this time the tower doesn't fall
whispered
removes a silver stick from the black base
sets the plastic turtle and the blue bear side by side on the coffee table
taps the blue arrow on the black base , but has trouble making them stick
puts a second silver stick in the middle of the tower of nuts
takes the arrow and places it on the yellow wand
touches the blue arrow to the black base
holds the wand high in the air and turns it upside down; the tower of nuts and the silver sticks remain in place

g.ga: tower of nuts on the wand

u.a: points tower of nuts towards Mot's face
points the tower at Mot's face , near her eyes
MOT turns her head away , Chi stands the tower of nuts on the table
EXP
removes the nuts from the yellow wand; the silver sticks remain
one of the silver sticks stands straight up , perpendicular to the wand
the standing silver stick falls
holds out the wand with the silver stick on top; the silver stick is standing
singing
takes the silver man and stands him on the yellow wand
the silver man isn't standing straight up; it leans slightly

g.ga: stand the silver man in a leaning position

u.a: both Chi and Mot work with their own silver men , each one trying to get his or her silver man to stand; Chi points to his man indicating that it is standing , but it isn't straignt up; Mot wants the silver men to be standing straight up
MOT demonstrates and Chi follows Mot's lead

g.ga: a certain spot on the black base
on a nut on the black base

u.a: picks up various objects from the table and puts them on the black base
tosses a dime on the black base; the dime falls off the base
picks up the thin , square , checkerboard magnet from the flat silver circle and touches it to the yellow wand and the black base
drops the square magnet on the yellow wand
picks up the thin square magnet
MOT stacks washers and nuts on the black base while Chi tries to get the thin square magnet to stick to the yellow wand
puts the thin square magnet on the flat silver circle
holds the flat silver circle high in the air and turns it upside down; the thin square magnet stays attached to the flat silver circle
removes thin square from the silver circle and puts the blue arrow onto the silver circle
turns the arrow over so that the black side of the arrow is touching the silver circle; the arrow attaches to the silver circle
the arrow is a magnet painted blue on one side only; the painted side does not stick well
sarcasm

g.ga: of the thin triangle and square magnets

u.a: puts the triangle and square in a line
brushes the triangle and square away
slides a coin into the twelve o'clock position next to the silver circle
slides a coin into the nine o'clock position next to the silver circle
singing
slides a coin into the three o'clock position next to the silver circle
singing
slides a coin into the six o'clock position next to the silver circle
spins the silver circle , which has the blue arrow on top of it , so that the arrow points to one of the coins

two silver sticks stand on the black base in the middle of a tower of nuts and washers; a silver man stands with one foot on top of one of the silver sticks; Mot is trying to get another silver man to stand on the other silver stick , but it falls

g.ga: second silver man standing on the second silver stick

u.a: <$=12> Mot and Chi are each doing their own thing; Mot is making a tower on the black base and Chi is spinning the silver circle with the blue arrow on top of it; each time the arrow ends up pointing at one of the coins , Chi removes the coin from its position
spins the silver circle
removes the coin from the six o'clock position
removes the coin from the three o'clock position
spins the silver circle several times and moves the last two coins from their positions
notices what Mot is doing and is interested in the silver man standing on one foot on top of the silver stick

u.a: takes the silver man Mot was using from Mot
stands a silver man on the silver sticks , a foot is on each stick
